name: Hotel Rey Alfonso X

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We walked from the train station with our luggage to the hotel and had no problems at all finding it. We were confused at how easy it was to find b/c we read other reviews saying it was hidden. The staff was helpful and professional. The rooms were nice and modern. The bathroom was also pretty big.
reviews.title: NOT hard to find at all...

reviews.text: We feel the location of the hotel was very convenient!
reviews.title: Nice location

reviews.text: The room was nice, free internet, clean, in a nice location but very diificult to find if walking from the train station but not far at all. Do not use the internet directions from google. You will not make it. No breakfast included which is always a downer--you had to pay 16 euros or something outrageous like that. Around the corner is a little diner like place--lovely, go there, go to Seville.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel at a nice location. Recommended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a very nice location, settled in the middle of Santa Cruz neighborhood, the old jewish area. Rooms are spacious and beautiful, and the one I was in also had a nice balcony overlooking the plaza. Its a few minutes walking from nearly all the touristic points in Sevilla, like the Catedral / Giralda and Alcazar, and even the Guadalquivir river with Torre do Oro and Triana neighborhood are close, in a easy walking distance. The only main sight not so close is Plaza de España.
reviews.title: nice hotel.....but what pain to find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only drawback of this Hotel is a consequence of its wonderful location, it's very hard to get there by car, driving through medieval streets, even with a GPS. However, the hotel has a convenient parking and didn't charge me for it.
reviews.title: Not a 4 star experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfect rooms in a good location (just 5 minutes walk from Cathedral & Reales Alcazares by quiet & narrow streets). Breakfast is unremarkable, better try the Horno San Buenaventura.
reviews.title: good location

reviews.text: After getting horribly lost in Seville's traffic system trying to find a car park, I ended up just heading for the first hotel with its own car parking. It was the Alfonso X. Parking was an extra €18. Room was overpriced, bed slid around on the floor, headboard rattled, air conditioning didn't work very well (and it was hot!), and breakfast not included.
reviews.title: great location but that's about it...

reviews.text: Fairly charmless and too expensive but in a great location.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: A perfect location for exploring the delights of seville
reviews.title: excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The air condicioned not work well!! Too hot!!
reviews.title: Good, but..

reviews.text: It's not easy finding a modern hotel in Seville over the internet. This is the only modern hotel at a reasonable price I can find, and it is located right in the centre of tourists' actions. There're many other hotels in Seville, but majority are boutique-style with an accompanying price tag, or far away from the historic centre -- which is where you want to be as a sight-seeing visitor!
reviews.title: Excellent location and modern hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room is spacious with full-length windows opening up to tiny balconies.
reviews.title: Everything great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lots of cafes and restaurants about. 90% of tourist attractions are within walking distance. AVE train station is a 5-10 min taxi ride away, depending on traffic. Bus terminal is almost within walking distance, but I do not suggest walking if you do not know Seville well. It is not possible to find the hotel on foot even with a map if you are brand new to the city and do not speak more Espanol than "Ola-Uno-Dos-Tres-Cuatros-Por Favor" - the historic town is a maze upon first arrival.
reviews.title: Rude and incompetent

reviews.text: We were looking forward to our trip to Seville seeing that we heard so much about this town. We booked into the Rey Alfonso hotel for 2 nights. Firstly finding the hotel was like finding a needle in a hay stack! And I guess not having a detailed map did not help. After trawling through the old town streets of seville for over 1 hour and asking numerous people for directions we arrived at the hotel tired,sweaty and hungry. The front desk person did not seem friendly or empathetic about our situation. After we got our room keys and check out our room we instantly realised that it was uncomfortably warm in the room and when we turned the air conditioning on only to find the A/C was blowing out hot air! We called reception to inform them of this problem only for them to explain to us that they were not planning to fix their air conditioning until su mmer time...I can only imagine how hot it gets in summer if its like this in spring and it was 29 degrees! They suggested we open the window which we did only to find it was awfully noisy from the street sounds and construction work taking place outside the hotel. Due to the very loud noises coming from outside, we then asked them if they could provide us with a fan to which they said they would look into but never called us back. As were about to step out that night we tried to explain to the same front desk person of our situation that due to the uncomfortably hot conditions in our hotel room and the fact the A/C was not working, we did try to open the window to which we would be affected by a terribly loud construction and restaurant/street noise at night and they did not provide us with a portable fan, we requested to be moved to a quieter room. The front desk person's response was that the street noise would die down later in the night and the construction work would stop and that all the rooms in the hotel are the same in terms of noise level ( which i did not believe one bit!) and concluding that all rooms were fully booked they were unable to move us to another room. We were not happy with this response and said we would see how the night went and would take this up with them in the morning if this was an on-going issue. As expected we were forced to open the window as it was very hot and we were kept up ALL night (I mean all night) with the construction work noises and loud restaurant/street noise which didn't stop until early dawn. I must have woken up least 8 times during the night and had 2 hours sleep altogether. Feeling extremley sleep deprived the next morning we spoke to recepetion (a different front desk person) explaining we were kept up all night with the terrible noise and insisted we get moved to a quiter room. The front desk person did explain they were fully booked that night but agreed they would move us to one of the back rooms which would be much more QUIETER. To our relief we moved rooms straight away and that night with still no air condittioning we were able to sleep soundly through out the night with out any irritating street/construction noise. See it doesn't take that much to tend to a small request which makes a big difference in a unpleasant stay to a pleasant stay. Thank you front desk person for tending to our complaint and preventing our hotel experience in seville turning into a total nightmare!!
reviews.title: Disappointing Front desk service

reviews.text: And funny that we did request to be placed in a quiet room at the back of the hotel when we initially booked on the internet...bewarned not all request get tended to.
reviews.title: Good Hotel GREAT Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Apart from the room issue, room was ok but could have have been cleaned better but location was great close to the tapa bars and cathedral but be prepared with a detailed map if you stay in one of the places in old town area.
reviews.title: good, modern hotel in central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One recommendation is that the hotel should train its staff on the customers is always right policy!
reviews.title: Excellent value hotel in a great location

reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights with friends for a New Year break 28-31 December 2008. We paid $100 per night per room through Expedia. The Hotel seemed almost deserted, but good rooms and great location within easy walking distance of Cathedral etc and restaurants/bars. Staff were very helpful, and even let us keep one of the rooms until we left for a late evening flight without charge, on condition we vacated if they had a sudden influx of guests. I would be very happy to come back here when I return to Seville, and sucha beautiful city I definitely will.
reviews.title: Loved the Secrotel Rey Alfonso X!

description: Hotel Rey Alfonso X is situated right in Seville’s historical city centre, in Santa Cruz quarter, just 1 minute from La Giralda. The hotel has its own parking, exclusive for customers, providing you with a parking in Seville’s city centre.The hotel has 60 rooms, including 9 unique and charming junior suites, complemented with the latest technological advances.The hotel has a sun terrace with bar and a small swimming pool, exclusively for its customers, where you can cool off and enjoy beautiful views of the Cathedral and the beautiful covers of old Seville with its layout of Hispano-Muslim heritage.These latest facilities correspond to the new reforms implemented in 2012, designed to offer the best service and an unforgettable stay.
